features: 64-page book of step-by-step instructions for building 10 LEGO race cars and a custom track to race two cars at the same time.
Includes all 124 bricks you need to build 10 different race cars, with variations in different colors and opportunity to mix-and-match pieces.
Offers the unique combination of STEM learning and playful creativity in line with Klutz's bestselling LEGO Chain Reactions, LEGO Gadgets, and LEGO Gear Bots.
body.description: The ultimate kit for LEGO fans and car enthusiasts alike! Assemble a high-quality chipboard track to set the scene for your LEGO derby, then build 10 LEGO race cars with step-by-step instructions and pit them against each other. Who will win--Phoenix '77, Winged Chariot, El Scorpio, or perhaps even a souped-up build you've customized yourself? Fun, non-fiction content highlights the coolest, fastest, and weirdest cars to ever exist. (Do you know the differences between NASCAR and Formula One? Did you know there's a car that runs on coffee?!) Learn aerodynamic tips and tricks to put phsyics into action, with this playful STEM kit that lets your build, rebuild, and experiment to create the best car in your LEGO collection!

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: What is Klutz? Klutz is a premium brand of book-based activity kits, designed to inspire creativity in every kid. Our unique combination of crystal-clear instructions, custom tools, materials, and hearty helpings of humor is guaranteed to kick-start creativity. Super-clear instructions Open-ended creativity Good for reluctant readers Develop skills to build on Includes everything you need to get started LEGO Race Cars Crash and learn with LEGO race cars! The ultimate kit for LEGO fans and car enthusiasts alike! Assemble a high-quality chipboard track to set the scene for your LEGO derby, then build 10 LEGO race cars with step-by-step instructions and pit them against each other. Fun, non-fiction content highlights the coolest, fastest, and weirdest cars to ever exist. Learn aerodynamic tips & tricks to put physics into action, with this playful STEM kit that lets you build, rebuild, and experiment to create the best car in your LEGO collection! 64-page book of step-by-step instructions for building 10 LEGO race cars and a custom track to race two cars at the same time. Includes all 124 bricks you need to build 10 different race cars, with variations in different colors and opportunity to mix-and-match pieces. Offers the unique combination of STEM learning and playful creativity in line with Klutz's bestselling LEGO Chain Reactions, LEGO Gadgets, and LEGO Gear Bots.

LEGO Chain Reactions LEGO Gear Bots LEGO Gadgets LEGO Minifigure Photography More great kits from LEGO and Klutz! Design and Build Amazing Moving Machines Build STEM-driven models, such as DJ Bubbles (an octopus spinning records), a pterodactyl, a yeti, and much more! Make, experiment, and play! Build 11 machines including a gravity powered car and a wacky boxing robot. Learn how to take great photos with LEGO minifigures!

reviews.reviewText: This is a fun set for kids who like to mix and match Lego cars.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Grandson loved it
reviews.reviewText: My y grandson loves Legos, so I got this for him from Santa.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2024
Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great cars, BUT I wouldn't buy again...here's why:
reviews.reviewText: The directions for building the ramp are wrong. The middle piece between the two lanes should be swapped. Also, the cars rarely make it all the way to the end because they swerve and hit the sides, so the entire point of half of this activity is pretty useless. Feels like a huge waste of money, excitement, time and effort.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fun Race Car Set
reviews.reviewText: Grandson requested this for Christmas, and he was very happy to get it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars It’s good but not what you think
reviews.reviewText: I feel this gift for my son was a bit deceptive. Although it does have a track you can build it falls apart easily. You also can’t build more than two cars at once. They are small also. But it is still a cool set and we did play with it. Just not what I expected

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I ordered this in the morning and later that early evening it was delivered. This is a Christmas gift for my grandson.. I know he’s going to love it.
